DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether randomization occurred post surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: randomization related to a surgical procedure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Surgical Procedure; a medical procedure involving an incision with instruments; performed to repair damage or arrest disease in a living body.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: The allocation of individuals to groups, e.g., for experimental and control regimens, by chance. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Randomization must occur =< 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Randomization must occur =< 56 days post surgery

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Randomization within 112 days of completion of surgery

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Randomization within 84 days of completion of surgery

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the interval between the last surgery for breast cancer (including re-excision of margins) and study entry no more than 70 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient within 8 weeks of primary surgery (or endometrial biopsy in patients who never undergo hysterectomy) at the time of study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the interval between surgery (post-operative Day 7) and study entry no more than 60 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the interval between the last surgery for breast cancer (including re-excision of margins) and pre-entry no more than 16 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the interval between surgery (post-operative Day 7) and Step 1/Study entry no more than 60 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the interval between the last surgery for breast cancer (including re-excision of margins) and pre-entry/Step 1 no more than 70 days?
